name: Hyatt Regency Louisville

reviews.text: We took had a little difficulty catching the parking deck the first trip around the hotel - but then were able to find it on our second drive around the block. The parking deck is a little scary, I will admit that, but safety is always in numbers.....
reviews.title: Happy in the Hyatt

likes.liked: — The great price we got on priceline.com, the room was nice...

reviews.text: Check in was relatively quick - the young girl behind the counter was more then willing to give us information on the area....and recommended us to Bistro 301 for dinner which was fabulous! I found our room to be very nice, it was a king sized bed....overlooking downtown Louisville. I didn't find anything wrong with the room, it was actually very clean and very nice in appearance. The only thing I greatly frowned upon was the $9.99 fee (daily) they wanted to charge you for WiFi...this didn't please me much...so I opted not to purchase it. Having free WiFi would have made me much happier....
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.text: But the hotel is downtown, nice location...all the staff was very nice except when checking out - the clerk really needed to lose the attitude. (I think she was very displeased with her job or something...) But that isn't anything that should deter you from staying here!
reviews.title: Not What I Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had previously stayed at the Brown in Louisville, but opted this time for the Hyatt for the price. While the lobby is old and outdated, the rooms were great! Spacious, clean, well laid out and very comfortable bed. Staff was great - I never waited long for anything, they did personal wake-up calls and offered to call back again in 15 minutes. I had a slow running drain and someone came up and fixed it no problem.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It doesn't have the glamour in the lobby of the Brown or Seelbach, but for the price and location, you can't do much better. I paid $130 a night for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Blech! Not worthy of the Hyatt Brand!

reviews.text: Just returned home after a one night stay at this hotel for a conference. Fairly typical Hyatt convention /business hotel experience. Staff was friendly and helpful. Can't speak about the restaurant facilities as there were several options nearby that we decided to try instead.
reviews.title: Just short of 4 stars

reviews.text: Rooms which were slightly small appeared to have been somewhat updated fairly recently. Bathroom was somewhat dated. Room was clean and comfortable, beds were OK.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby area was an atrium style with escalators leading to the conference area on the 2nd level.
reviews.title: Great place, great location!

likes.disliked: — Ask for a view of 4th street

reviews.text: A previous reviewer was very critical of this property, using Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons properties as a comparison. I felt this was an unfair comparison. Some of the rest of us also stay at RC and FS properties and understand the difference.
reviews.title: I wanted to move in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish I could have given this Hotel a 3.5 star rating but that was not an option. despite a few small short comings I still feel like we had a good stay here.
reviews.title: Great hotel great staff - would stay again

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice and clean, however the atrium style created an affect where sound travels upwards. In order to fall asleep I had to put on the fan for white noise.
reviews.title: Not very quiet atrium style hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was clean. I can't fault the housekeeping at all.
reviews.title: Relocated thanks to noisy people

likes.liked: — We were asked to move to avoid noisy people at 3:30 AM. We were staying 2 weeks. They were staying a night. This is ridiculous for $134/night.

reviews.text: Before the end of the first week of my two week stay, I had a problem with people in a neighboring room being noisy (shouting profanities at the TV, which could also be heard clearly). I was asked to move rooms (which happened at 3:30 AM), being told that the people next door were staying one night, and the staff knowing I was to be staying another week.
reviews.title: Great Hotel--too bad too noisy!

reviews.text: The front desk did find a room for me immediately, and did help me move my bags, but it surprises me that they can't imagine someone wanting to sleep in a room primarily consisting of a bed at 3:30 at night. At $134/night, I am depressed realizing I've done better for less than $50.
reviews.title: Excellent room

reviews.text: Having stayed in numerous hotels, I'd say that the Hyatt was the absolutely cleanest, well-kept hotel that I have ever stayed. I would stay in this lovely hotel again, except for the fact that it was the most noisy hotel out of all my travels. The walls were paper thin, the activity in the lobby echoed all the way up to the 5th floor until at least 1:00 a.m., and their lobby music woke me up at 7:00 a.m. and continued blaring until I made a phone call to the front desk. What a shame that such a wonderful hotel was built without concern for the noise level. It architectually wasn't designed with the noise level in mind!
reviews.title: Great rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very pleased with the Hyatt. We went to see some concerts at Fourth Street Live and the location was just across the street. Check-in was fast and the staff was courteous. The hotel seemed to have been renovated or updated because the carpet, tile and rooms were new looking. I especially loved the bathrooms! I eat bagels at breakfast and that's not usually easy to find but the hotel had a Starbuck's in the lobby and, lo and behold, they had my "everything" bagels and the female attendant fixed me a cappuccino just exactly the way I special ordered it. The parking garage has a walkway from the third level right onto the second floor and the lobby has an escalator to the first floor. There were security cameras everywhere and I felt very safe. I had to go to the parking garage at 3 a.m. once and the parking garage security was there before I even knew it making sure everything was alright. Wow. I could not find one bad thing to say about the Hyatt. This was a great trip and I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and great staff

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hyatt for one night. Friendly staff and very helpful. Great location walk to almost everything. Hotel room was very clean and comfortable with very nice decor. Excellent bed with wonderful pillows. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Great location, but not so easy finding the parking and entrance to the hotel. Only 1 block from 4th st live. On the trolley lines. Nice room, clean, comfortable bed. Only problem was the noise from the atrium lobby and other floors.
reviews.title: great location

description: Open-Atrium style property, 393 guestroom hotel. Property features complimentary Hyatt Stay Fit Gym access, coffee maker, hair dryer, high speed wireless Internet and voice mail. High-speed access in meeting room and guestrooms. Connected by skywalk to the Kentucky International Convention Center and 4th Street Live!, Louisville's newest entertainment venue with over 300,000 square feet of specialty restaurants, bars and retail. Hotel is minutes from Churchill Downs, Papa John's Football Stadium and Louisville International Airport. Walk to Waterfront Park, Muhammad Ali Center, Slugger Field, Frazier Historical Arms Museum, Louisville Science Center, Actors Theater, Louisville Slugger Museum & Factory, Kentucky Center (home of the touring Broadway Shows, Louisville Orchestra and Ballet, and art galleries).
